com.psddev.dari.util

Class AbstractFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.psddev.dari.util.AbstractFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Filter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ApplicationFilter, CachingDatabaseFilter, DebugFilter, HeaderResponseFilter, LogCaptureFilter, MultipartRequestFilter, PageContextFilter, PingFilter, ProfilerFilter, ProfilingDatabaseFilter, ResetFilter, ResourceFilter, ReusableRequestFilter, SessionIdFilter, SourceFilter, StandardFilter, StatsFilter, TaskFilter, Utf8Filter

    public abstract class AbstractFilter
extends Object
implements javax.servlet.Filter
    Skeletal implementation of Filter.

    Typically, a subclass only needs to override doRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain) to process a normal page request. Unlike the servlet filter interface, however, this class has separate hooks for different types of dispatches:

    • doError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain)
    • doForward(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain)
    • doInclude(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain)

    Note that these methods will only trigger if the corresponding <dispatcher/> tags are defined in <filter-mapping/> like so:

    <filter-mapping>
    <dispatcher>ERROR</dispatcher>
    <dispatcher>FORWARD</dispatcher>
    <dispatcher>INCLUDE</dispatcher>
    <dispatcher>REQUEST</dispatcher>
</filter-mapping>

    One time initialization and destruction logic should be defined in:

    • doInit()
    • doDestroy()

    Additionally, a subclass can override dependencies() to declare other filter classes that it depends on. These dependencies will be executed automatically before each of the phases in processing the filter.

    • Field Detail

      • DISABLE_FILTER_SETTING_PREFIX

        public static final String DISABLE_FILTER_SETTING_PREFIX
        Settings key prefix for disabling a filter.

        For example, if you set dari/disableFilter/my.Filter to true, instances of my.Filter class won't do anything.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        protected void doInit()
               throws Exception

      • doFilter

        public final void doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request,
            javax.servlet.ServletResponse response,
            javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
                    throws IOException,
                           javax.servlet.ServletException
        Filters a page after processing it with all other dependencies. A subclass can override doError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain), doInclude(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain), doForward(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain), and/or doRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain) to provide additional functionality.
        Specified by:
        doFilter in interface javax.servlet.Filter
        Parameters:
        request - Can't be null.
        response - Can't be null.
        chain - Can't be null.
        Throws:
        IOException
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • doDispatch

        protected void doDispatch(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
              javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
                   throws Exception
        Triggers when this filter needs to process a page. This method will delegate to one of: doError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain), doInclude(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain), doForward(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain), or doRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain).
        Parameters:
        request - Can't be null.
        response - Can't be null.
        chain - Can't be null.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • doInclude

        protected void doInclude(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
             javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
                  throws Exception
        Triggers when this filter needs to process an included page. Note that the servlet specification requires <dispatcher>INCLUDE</dispatcher> to be declared in <filter-mapping/> for this to work.
        Parameters:
        request - Can't be null.
        response - Can't be null.
        chain - Can't be null.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • doError

        protected void doError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
           javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
                throws Exception
        Triggers when this filter needs to process an error page. Default implementation calls doRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain). Note that the servlet specification requires <dispatcher>ERROR</dispatcher> to be declared in <filter-mapping/> for this to work.
        Parameters:
        request - Can't be null.
        response - Can't be null.
        chain - Can't be null.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • doForward

        protected void doForward(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
             javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
                  throws Exception
        Triggers when this filter needs to process a forwarded page. Note that the servlet specification requires <dispatcher>FORWARD</dispatcher> to be declared in <filter-mapping/> for this to work.
        Parameters:
        request - Can't be null.
        response - Can't be null.
        chain - Can't be null.
        Throws:
        Exception
